reviews.text: Thanks to the wonderful gentleman who treated my Perth friend to a special treat. A fantastic remembrance of her trip to Ballarat. Highly recommend.

We stumbled across the Tramway Museum on a walk around Lake Wendouree today... Neville greeted us straight away and gave us a personal tour through the Museum and workshop ... Neville walked and talked us through all the history about the Ballarat Trams and Restoration. What a lovely guy! We couldn’t thank him enough great little stop in!

First of all, we were so lucky to find the museum open at 7 pm. Secondly, 74  years old volunteer engineer gave us a tour and he was very helpful,  knowledgeable and friendly. Thank you SIR for accommodating us so late, we will remember you and museum.

BEAUTIFULLY RESTORED TRAMS THAT WERE ONCE REGULAR PUBLIC TRANSPORT IN BALLARAT
The trams now run only on a short track at the Botanical Gardens at Lake Wendouree but it's well worth a visit. $5 for adults and discount for a family ticket for a pleasant trip on the tram. The museum is worth checking out too.
Awesome and you should also have the tram ride and see how they change its sides.

The Kryal Castle was excellent because it had loads of fun places we could visit. It also had a real castle structure in the front which made me super thrilled! Kryal Castle had cool structures and things which won't happen in real life. It was amazing!

Excellent theme park, very authentic and great attention to detail.
So much to see and do, and even the kids are looked after with a giant jumping castle and kids play area.
The jousting was amazing as was the theme of Robin Hood.
The photographer was excellent where you got to dress up and get photos done any way you wanted.
We had a wonderful time. 10 out of 10

Great family experience. Of all the places we visited last year, our son loved Kryal castle the most. We saw jousting and there was even a potion class. We stayed overnight in some of the accommodation, which was also very comfortable. We will be returning.

A great place for the kids, the dragon story and the torture chamber are well done. The torture chamber might be a little scary and too gruesome for the little ones. The maze was fun. But the best thing is the jousting and the archery. Don't forget the blacksmith. They also have accommodation with a medieval flavor. Recommended for a great day out.

Awesome place. Have been several times. Now a yearly event for SS Owners Club Vic. Staff were very friendly and the interaction was amazing...especially for the kids. I could not get sick of this place. So much to see and do.

Very authentic place to visit and well laid out but make sure you wear proper footwear as it's all dirt and up and down hill.
But well worth the visit.
The gold panning in the creek was lots of fun especially because you get to keep the gold that you find.
We tasted the best pies and sausage rolls at the bakery; highly recommended.
Loved the stage coach ride too.

What a fabulous place to visit. Bring your wallet and get here early for a great day. Make sure that you check the timetable so that you catch the reenactments and demonstrations. Musket firing, gold panning, sweet making, pantomime, mine tours, coach rides... The list goes on and on. Bring a picnic or buy food here. You really need a couple of days to see it all. Make sure that you wear comfortable shoes. Enjoy going back to the Gold rush in the 1800s.

Fantastic place. Staff helpful, friendly and very informative. The staff around the site were always happy to talk to the kids and have a bit of fun. 

Loads of information around and lots of people to ask questions if you couldn't find something specific.

So much to look at and so many activities! Could have spent more than a day here really! (And we couldn't even do the mine trip as our kids are too little)

I've lived most of my life in Melbourne and this is the first time I've visited Sovereign Hill.
The entry is $57 per adult.
It's well worth the entry price.
It's stepping back in time to the 1800's. You really get  a sense of what it was like to live in that time.
Highly recommend going.
Get there early and spend the whole day.

A great experience for those who enjoy the historic side of Victoria and the mining boom. A great family day out - could spend hours wandering round. Would recommend the mine tour too. Great experience!

An interesting place to visit if you're in the Ballarat area. Lots of information on the region's history and great bits and pieces to see, many of which are also interactive. A two minute walk from Sovereign Hill definitely makes the museum a worthwhile part of any Sovereign Hill visit. Pictured are the cylinders from a Japanese flamethrower (Second World War).
Great museum which covers all aspects of gold mining in the region. You can do it as part of Sovereign Hill or on its own. Loved reading all about the history :)

We had heard that this was the #1 museum in Bogota, and weren't disappointed. The collection is wonderful, but what we liked best was the many ways in which it was informed by the history of the indigenous people of Colombia, the methods of working gold and other metals, etc. I only wished there had been more information on how this much gold escaped Spanish predation, and the archaeology of its recovery. But that's minor in comparison with the displays and presentation. This is a DON'T MISS!
The whole museum is well laid out and presents a great overview of the history of Ballarat and the goldfields, along with interesting historical artifacts. Very Informative!

Museum is very interactive and interesting for both kids and adults. It will give you a lot of information about the mining history of Ballarat and the establishment of the city. Also big thanks to volunteer Joan, it was very very pleasant to talk to her and ask her a lot of question about the museum and life of the city. Highly recommended.
Nice calm quite place for a coffee. I always love meeting someone who is passionate about something, the worker was a very optimistic coffee enthusiastic man.
Great coffee, good service, OK sit in atmosphere. Own roasted beans.
If you like your coffee rich and strong this is one of the better places in Ballarat. The staff make you feel very welcome.

As a barista for 10 years and manager of many cafe's i was extremely happy to find a locally made and well made at that grind. The staff are knowledgeable they love their coffee. only gripe is that i have to ask for sugar each time i have a coffee and ive been lectured thrice about sugar. if it happens again i might just spit the dummy :) 

all that aside if you want a really good "CONSISTANT" coffee in Ballarat this is the only place.
Great service. Friendly staff. Awesome coffee.
Business now closed as of late 2017. Great Italian cuisine and pleasant surrounds with good table service. Food is well priced.

Look, if you've had Italian friends you'd understand they are often bold and precise characters, this can come across as rude, they aren't trying to be rude I'd say they're more so in "action mode" not "slave mode" that we're use to.
Real Italian feel and real Italian flavours. It is an experience.
Trio of dips is the best I've had in Ballarat yet. They offered more bread for our left over dip which is really nice!
Sorry to hear it is closing - best Italian restaurant in Ballarat for many years

Found the owners customer service very poor and came across as rude, however the one waitress he had working was professional and friendly.. hard to give this place anymore than one star as the chicken I had was the driest I 've ever eaten and the pasta had chillies in it that wasn't advertised on the menu
Great staff and great food will defintaly be back

Coffee is excellent. I ordered the scrambled eggs and they were well prepared, if a little runny. Not a massive variety in the menu.

Ambience is dark and reminiscent of an old school bookshop. Staff were friendly and service was very quick.

One of the more underrated spots for a meal or snack, L'espresso is a nice, relaxing, spot in the middle of Ballarat. It has plenty of options available for eaters - vegetarian, gluten free - and the staff are very accommodating. The atmosphere is made even better by the music, which is set at a level that allows you to chat and not yell. I ate here frequently during my time in Ballarat and I will be returning whenever I visit the area.

Excellent service and more importantly excellent coffee. A lovely quaint little cafe in the heart of Ballarat. The atmosphere helped by the unobtrusive yet relaxing playlist was about right for a cosy place like this. Plenty of outdoor seating also available.
Whilst good value, the Butcher muesli left a bit to be desired. Some yoghurt, fewer sultanas and more finely shredded apple would improve it.

Great service, tea is good.
Ambiance is very cool.
No WIFI 😢
Food was nice came out quickly

The Ballarat amateur Radio Group attended the restaurant last night, 26 of us in total.  We just had the best experience, food was fresh , meals so tasty, service wonderful.  Meals came out so quickly. Staff made the evening, so helpful.  No problems, able to pay seperately.  Was a great place for a large group to attend for an evening out..
Good food bit formal staff kind of get treated like cattle?

Won't be going back. Ordered a vegetarian dish and it's 90% onion. 
Had to pay extra for a veg fried rice that wasn't even fried, no egg at all. 
Came home to fry my own egg and add it. Flavorless....
My partner got a chicken dish that was very plain and very little sauce.
For a hefty price too. Going elsewhere.
Beware. The food is horrible and not worth your time, effort or money.

Lovely meal & staff. We sat right up the front of the restaurant by the window, it was pretty looking out onto the street with the fairy lights. Staff were all very pleasant, our meals came out quickly & were very good

We are new to Ballarat, so first time here, and we had a lovely lunch.  Nice food, great service, super friendly.  Satay beef and lemon chicken were both delicious,  and very gererous servings.   We will definitely be back again.  Thank you!
In general it is a decent restaurant, good coconut rice. The hotpot however was to salty.

Take away* 

Delicious food, quickly made, friendly service and decent pricing.

Only negative, wasn't much satay sauce should definitely have more in the container.

It is quite pricey but the eggplant claypot is absolutely my favorite here, in fact I always order this all the time m. I have ordered here through menulog numerous times now, there is $5 delivery fee if you ordered food via menulog and they are never disappointed me in delivering it on time.

Used to love coming here as a kid...always had birthday parties here and honestly thought it was the best. 
As an adult I do find it hard to choose something I like and I do have my reserves about the savoury pancake dishes even though I know they taste good. 
The cottage fries are always delicious and filling and the pancakes are always light and fluffy and very tasty. Great place to take the kids for a special treat and awesome place for birthday parties but does get very busy so bookings are essential. Very accommodating to babies and they have newspapers and a giant chess table if you get a little bored.
Wonderful experience here. All 9 meals were delicious and served promptly. Staff were very courteous

We had a group breakfast n new year's Day. We were surprised to see that they were open so early. We were well looked after by the staff. Linda was fantastic to ensure we were comfortable and had everything we needed. The food was good and had a good variety so our Vegan friend only could join us for breakfast.
Took my twin grandsons for a special breakfast treat.  The food was delicious. But I did find it very expensive.

Excellent service my coffee ☕ was made just the way I like it
Thank you 😍 😍 😍
Warm Regards Rita Gilbert

The place is impeccably laid out.  The service was friendly and speedy without being pushy. We tried the two buns entree  for the first time.  Magnificent.  Our main courses were each enjoyed immensely.  With a well priced bottle of wine it was a lovely and affordable meal.

All of our group couldn't stop talking about how great the experience was. The food was full of flavour with perfect portion sizes. Good value for money. Timely service. Friendly staff. Cozy environment. Will definitely be back!! 
Thank you!!!
Very impressed with this place. We felt very welcomed from the moment we walked in. The food was amazing. Very happy overall and would highly recommend.

Have been there on our day trip to Sovereign Hill. The food was delicious, the staff was polite. Have ordered Pad thai rice, the only thing that can be improved is the service, I've to remind the waiter for our order but that was very busy day and peak time. Good experience overall.

Visited this restaurant on my trip to Melbourne a week ago, the service was friendly and welcoming.

The waitress serving us had doubled checked to make sure all our meals met our dietary requirements and also made some excellent dish recommendations.

The Coconut milk soup was amazing, it was flavourful, creaming and tangy at the same time.

They also made The Larb Tofu without the fish sauce to met our vegetarian needs, it was bursting with flavours from the herbs.

Will definitely consider this place if I ever revisit Ballarat again.

I had high hopes for Zaragosa after the move from Victoria street a few years ago. Being an out of towner, a decent Mexican place  is a great place to end up at for a satisfying meal. Zarigosa was a huge disappointment. We arrived, no one was eating there. After a medley of microwave beeps and dry meat, the bill was a little hard to swallow.  Service was amazing though.
Good meal and atmosphere. A little slow between ordering and getting the meal. If you are not hungry when you order you will be by the time you get it.

What a fantastic night.  The meals were accomadating to all our needs offering non Mexican items for our family who weren't feeling adventurous. Great atmosphere,  the lady on the Floor was friendly and very helpful.   Can't wait to go back!
Menu was lacking and service was poor. Who runs out of ice at 9pm on a Saturday night?
Great food! staff are lovely and accommodating. Valencia Paella went down a treat after the jalapeno poppers. Ham croquets highly recommended as well.
